abstract: Hugh Jackman's new concert on Broadway set a house record at the Broadhurst Theater, earning more than of $1.2 million last week, a result of the producers' decision to charge exorbitant prices for tickets.
snippet: Hugh Jackman's new concert on Broadway set a house record at the Broadhurst Theater, earning more than of $1.2 million last week, a result of the producers' decision to charge exorbitant prices for tickets.
lead_paragraph: Hugh Jackman's new concert on Broadway set a house record at the Broadhurst Theater, earning more than of $1.2 million last week, a result of the producers' decision to charge exorbitant prices for tickets to Mr. Jackman's first return to Broadway as a singer since his Tony Award-winning performance in "The Boy from Oz" eight years ago. The previous record at the Broadhurst was about $1.18 million set by a production of "Merchant of Venice" starring Al Pacino during the week between Christmas and New Year's Day last season.

headline.main: Hugh Jackman's Show Earns More Than $1.2 Million
